numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Different countries have different relationships between the year and the amount of generated electricity.
2. China exhibits a strong linear growth in generated electricity between 2000 and 2020.
3. India exhibits a more gradual growth in generated electricity between 2000 and 2020.
4. The United States exhibits a relatively stable amount of generated electricity between 2000 and 2020.
5. Overall, all countries seem to use more clean sources than fossil sources for generating electricity.
6. Nuclear energy is a clean source.
7. This situation makes me wonder whether the world is getting cleaner.
8. This situation also makes me wonder whether these countries are slowly moving away from fossil fuels for generating electricity.
9. This situation is relevant to me and my community.
10. Nuclear energy does not produce air pollution.
11. Hydroelectric energy does not produce air pollution.
12. Some fossil fuels produce air pollution.
13. Some fossil fuels are notorious for producing air pollution.
14. My community and I want to live safer lives.
15. My community and I want to live healthier lives.
16. These issues are things to consider.
17. The headline is: The Race Between Clean Energy and Fossil Fuels Continues.
